summary: This bill, the Hawaii Native Species Conservation and Recovery Act of 2025, establishes a grant program managed by the Secretary of the Interior to support the conservation and recovery of native plant, fungi, and animal species in Hawaii. The program provides funding to eligible entities (state, local governments, Native Hawaiian organizations, nonprofits, businesses, and higher education institutions) for projects addressing invasive species, climate change impacts, habitat loss, and promoting public engagement. The bill outlines funding priorities, criteria, cost-sharing provisions, and requires annual reporting to Congress. It authorizes $30 million annually for ten fiscal years, with a portion earmarked for specific project types.
